page.title: 02TRESPRISSON FARM
page.content: Mr Williams owns{Tresprisson Farm, which is next to Mullion School. The farm has been in his family for 52 years. He has{170 acres:}35 acres of oats and barley, 60 of silage, 8 of hay and 67 for grazing cattle. Mr Williams has{55 cows}(54 Fresians and 1 Guernsey), and{95 bullocks and {calves.}He has 1 pig, 3 geese, 3 goslings and a large number of chickens.{Horses}were used on the land until 20 years ago, when tractors were introduced. He has{3 tractors,}2, 8 and 26 years old. The newest tractor cost Â£10,500. The 8 year old tractor cost Â£5,300. Their oldest tractor cost Â£800. He also has an old cider press which originally was run by horse but is now run by tractor. The old{farm {buildings}are built of granite and cob; the new are built of concrete with asbestos roofs.
